document_title: The School Admissions (Admission Arrangements and Co-ordination of Admission Arrangements) (England) Regulations 2012

duties.duty_description: Ensure the regulations are cited correctly, come into force on the specified date, and apply to the relevant academic years and schools in England.
Interpret terms and references within the regulations according to the definitions provided.
Revoke specified previous regulations while saving certain provisions for specific academic years.

Admission authorities must give first priority to looked after children in their oversubscription criteria, with specific exceptions for grammar schools, religious schools, and schools with pre-existing selection arrangements.
Consult specified persons and bodies about proposed admission arrangements, ensuring the consultation covers all relevant matters and follows the prescribed procedures.
Publish the determined admission arrangements on the local authority's website by the specified date, including information on the right to object.
